description:
Hands down, this is our family's favorite pizza place in the neighborhood. Village is the best NY style pizza on our side of Inner Richmond. 

I lived in NY for awhile and this is the closest thing to NY pizza that I've had on this side of town. It's delicious, really. The crust has that slight pull you want in a good pizza. We tried the Sicilian last night and that was great too. 

I'm not sure what all the picky reviews are about. Maybe the gross (shockingly crowded) pizza place down the street is trolling. Nothing else explains it. 

Also, delivery is fast.
author: Seth F.

description:
This review if primarily for office delivery.

Good pizza for sharing with your coworkers.  I usually order us the Village Special Sicilian style (that's deep dish).  They come in HUGE square slices and will fill you up instantly.  Unfortunately, I haven't tried anything else on their menu; I will eventually (hopefully).

Delivery is good, dependent on the weather and/or traffic.  The pizza is still hot when it gets here.  The delivery person is always nice and friendly.  I wish I knew what his name was...
author: Marie M.

description: Food pizza like the dough the deliver need to improve pizza normally gets in a little bit cold
author: A. M.

description:
Parents were craving for pizza, so we decided to give this place a try.
The waiter was very kind and helped us choose the size of the pizza. He also came to our table to refill my dad's coffee before he even asked. 
The food was great. We ordered the 14 inch pizza and a small salad. It may not be enough for big eaters, but it was perfect for us. There's enough variety of pizza, so when you come here with a big group, try different ones!
author: Kiyomi K.

description:
The menu states Greek olives and they also separately list black olives and green olives.  Unclear whether laziness or deceit but this is now the 3rd time I have received black or green olives instead of the kalamata/greek olives I was expecting.  

And the first time this happened, the cook kept deflecting blame, and telling me I was wrong.  (I know the difference between plain black olives and Greek olives).  

My fault for patronizing this place more than once due to proximity and SO's love of thin crust.  *SIGH*
author: Nivita S.

description: Ordered a medium cheese and BBQ wings for about $32. Dough was very tough and chewy. Got burnt and soggy BBQ wings. Next time, will just get Costco pizza if I want another crappy meal and save me $22.
author: Mi M.

description: The clam & garlic pizza is the main attraction here. Large pizzas are available and the salads are good and fresh too. Wide selections. Also a lot of beers to choose from and a decent choice of wines. Friendly service in a nice local inner Richmond District neighborhood.
author: Lucy L.

description: We were trying this place for my daughters 18th birthday party with her friends. Hummmmm pizza???? Sicilian style pizza ??? We were very very disappointed. Crust tasted like pillsbury dough or something. I think pilksbury taste better than this. Pricey for an awful pizza. It wasn't even a pizza. Very cheap on the sauce and probably super thin sliced of cheese. I am not a pizza lover. Thank god they accidentally sent half instead of a whole Sicilian pizza. Expensive awe full tasting pizza and we were hungry for a nice warm pizza on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Rickey Y.

description: We ended up here by accident we were suppose to go to Giorgio down the street. We saw pizza and pulled over we were so hungry. First there was meter parking yay! Waitress was super nice, attentive and made sure we knew the large calzone waa huge. Awesome we want two. the calzone crust was nice and crunchy, and I can pick up the slice. It was really good!
author: Michelle O.

description: Great food. A little pricey for pasta, but this is SF. I really like their Chef's Special Pasta and caprese salad. My husband usually gets a large summer salad.  Tasty and fresh. We order pizza occasionally.  I prefer the thin crust. We typically do take out.
author: Denise M.

description:
To begin with I wish we had the ability to do half points because I really would like to be able to give 5 stars to the waitress who was amazing! To set the scene I had spaced it thinking I was going to Giorgio's so I was kind of thrown at first since I had not eaten here but KNEW I LOVED Giorgio's. However my Cousin whom I was reconnecting with after 30 plus years chose this location and in the tidal wave of emotion was caught off guard and well lets face it they are both on a corner of Clement and something so I got confused. No biggie I am always up for an adventure. Now back to the waitress and why she deserves the 5 stars. From the moment we got there an electric pink smile was planted permanently upon her face but in the most sincerest manners. She spoke in a tone that told us that when she was at our table her attention belonged to us. During our visit she she checked on us just enough  so we did not feel abandoned. However gave us room to talk and share stories of our past. When she was taking our orders she gave suggestions for the menu and descriptions and steered us in understanding directions in that seemed to say, "Ya you might like this better." I had brought my 21 year old son with me who was as picky about his pizza as my Cousin and the waitress was quick with the answer. 
 Now the food. We got a large Neapolitan pizza with half pepperoni and half mushroom. We asked for extra mushroom. Good thing we did. I would be scared to think how many mushrooms would have been on there otherwise. The mushrooms tended to be lumped in areas as well. The edged of the crust was ok when it first came out but quickly became very hard and dry. Making it difficult to eat unless you had something to dip it in. We did not. The other two at the table seemed to be enjoying the pizza. I found it to be on the gummy side. 
  I had ordered a side salad that was fabulous! It was fresh and crisp. Their dressing were fantastic. The balsamic and ranch were delightful. It came with a dry little garlic roll which with ok when you ate it with the salad.
  The dessert was extremely delish! We ordered the cheesecake, flan and  Tiramisu. Light, lovely and oh so sinful! I do not have a negative thing to say. Oh wait yes I do. Shame on them for not having espresso to go with such fab desserts! So we ordered coffee which was AWFUL because I pretty sure had been sitting in the pot since 1982. But the waitress made a fresh pot without and brought two cups and sweet smile that almost put the desserts to shame. 
 Oh and I am a FREAK about a clean bathroom and I am almost ALMOST willing to give 5 stars JUST for the clean bathroom ESPECIALLY in SF. That is a FREAKING miracle. But being it is a pizza place. Oh and I forgot about the meatballs I ordered. Two meatballs. Super excited. They come out and are the size of golf balls. Kind of sad. They were ok. The sauce was amazing. The meatballs themselves. Meh. So one plus 12 minus 15 plus green equals three. I give them three stars for this visit.
author: Orleana P.

description: The dessert pizza will have you going bananas and drooling Nutella! Don't knock it till you've tried it! I have to restrain myself from ordering this. Enjoy!
author: Raimi Y.

description:
This is a very cozy, yet spacious, family-friendly pizzeria. Mr. Joy and I had dinner here once whilst walking around the neighborhood on a warm day.

We ordered a pizza that was half a carnivore's delight and half an Italian supreme.
Carnivore's Delight - pepperoni, meatball, sausage, salami &
Italian Supreme - chicken, spinach, fresh mozzarella, tomatoes:
The crust was thin and crisp along the edges, a little floppy in the center, and not too sauce-y. I enjoyed all the toppings, except for the meatball slices. The flavor was off.

Baked Homemade Meatballs - marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese:
Meatballs were 0 for 2. They did not taste homemade to me. The flavor was a little too reminiscent of processed meat, even though they were covered in sauce & cheese.

I thought the pizza was alright. I would return for a quick slice.
author: Joy W.

description:
Today I gave them the benefit of the doubt. 

Months ago I ordered from this place. While ordering, the girl repeats my order, tells me the amount, and the wait time (40-60min). We waited an hour and 20 minutes for the pizzas. After the long wait, we realize they gave us the wrong order. We ordered 1 pep 1 cheese. We got 2 cheese. The kids were starving and in a bad mood. I called them and the girl said that they charged us for 2 cheese and that they can deliver the pep after I pay the difference and it would be another 30min. I tell her she needs to make this right because we've been waiting and it's ridiculous that she still wants to charge me the difference. After 5 min of her trying to fix this, she finally talks to the manager and he was kind enough to send us the pep at no charge. 

Today I ordered 2 large pep and 1 medium pep. When I asked the amount, I could've sworn I heard her say it would be $59. This time I personally picked up the pizzas to avoid the long wait and make sure I get the right order. The place was empty. The cashier girl seemed like her mind was elsewhere. When I pay, it turns out that the amount is $69. Whatever, I'll pay it. I ask her for plates and she asks how many. I ask for 10 thinking she'll just grab a nice stack of plates. She literally counted each plate and gave me exactly 10. I wasn't offered any cheese or pepper. I honestly didn't bother asking her for any because she already looked annoyed when I asked for the plates. 

Never ordering from here again. Overpriced pizza, bad customer service, and they apparently can't afford to give paying customers plates and/or condiments.
author: Jewelz H.

description: Wow. Pleasantly surprised. Have ordered on different apps and service is consistently on point. I'm from the East coast and in a pinch it takes me home. Nice job Village!
author: Corey D.

description: There is plenty of space and enough opportunities to sit down. We were there at a evening and it was too cold for me in there. The service is okay but when I order an appetizer I expect to get it before and not with the main dish so it was confusing bc the table was too small for all the plates. I ordered half Chicken BBQ and Half Hawaii Pizza it was okay but not the best one I've ever tried. The BBQ Chicken Wings weren't good at all and the veggies with it not fresh that was a bit disappointing. A good spot for bigger parties and an uncomplicated, easy dinner/lunch.
author: Sophie H.

description:
We took 2 slices of chef's special and a small caprese salad. That was exactly right for 2 people.

Decent pizza, not extremely salted as pizzas from other popular places, fresh vegetables that do have taste, excellent texture and right amount cheese.
author: Ilya K.

description:
Ordered the clam and garlic pizza. It was delicious and is enough to get me to come back for more!

I also had the tiramisu cake--this was no good.
author: Hello E.

description: This place is has some good pasta, not so great stuff and menu is pretty normal, pizza is kind of okay.
author: Dhruv A.

description: Finally I got to try this place. I went at a good time because we were the first. I like the location. Great service. Good food and price. It was more than bargain for. Would go again.
author: C G.

description: Very disappointed in this location. Food was decent, but waiter ran my credit card for multiple checks resulting in fraudulent charges on my card. When confronted, the staff would lie about the incident and the manger chose not to deal with the situation properly( either saying there was nothing he could do or lie that he wasn't in the location). Stealing from your customers is never okay, lying about it is even worse.
author: Mitchell S.

description:
My parents love this place, and I think it is fine but not especially great. It is usually easy to get a table here without a wait, and that is nice. 

The salads are generic at best. The pizza is okay. The crust isn't quite thin enough for me, and the sauce lacks umami. Toppings were good but not generous. 

Our waitress was really nice and attentive. She made the mediocre dining experience pleasant.
author: michelle l.

description:
With the caveat I have never eaten inside the place, here's my review.

The pizza is very good American pizza. Fresh ingredients, great crust. Delivery is 45 mins or less - well not on special occasion nights like Superbowl etc, but that's to be expected.

Last night we were driving back from Monterey and since we live three blocks away we decided to pick up. We called 30 mins out, and they said food would be ready in 25 mins. They called exactly 25 mins later to tell us the food was ready - nice no? We picked up a pie and 12 wings piping hot. Great pizza and tasty and meaty wings. If you live in Inner Richmond, this is your pizza delivery place.
author: Massimo M.

description: For the past few months, I have been working in the Richmond area of SF and stumbled across this place. I ordered a pizza pie with some folks, which was good, but I felt like it was overpriced. I have also enjoyed the chicken wings on more than one occasion. The Village Pizzeria is totally decent and the staff is nice. It's totally okay.
author: Lawren B.

description: I am an unashamed pizza snob. I have extremely exacting standards when it comes to pizza. If most pizza seems bland and boring to you, then we are fellow travelers through the ocean of mediocre pizza in the bay area. Village Pizzeria is an island of excellent pizza in that bland ocean. The crust, sauce, and toppings are excellent. I've been going to Village at least once a week for at least a decade. As such, I am a known customer, so I will say that for the average customer service can be unreliable. If the staff is slow to notice you, don't be afraid to give them a holler to get their attention. The only other issue is that the place is a popular destination for children's birthday parties and sports teams. I always bring a pair of earplugs with me, since I like to read when I eat. About one visit in five I need to use those earplugs, because of the screaming kids. Also, I always order whole pizzas, never slices, so I cannot answer to the quality or lack thereof of individual slices. Beyond that, I cannot be effusive enough in my praise.
author: Tony B.

description:
I'm a girl who likes variety. When I saw that delivery.com was doing 30% off and Village Pizzeria delivers slices, I was sold!

*Chicken wings: spicy sauce ($10.90 for 12 pieces)
Skip these. They taste like the hot wings you buy at Costco and then microwaved. No crispiness to the outside. Just mushy and not very appealing.

Slices:
*Clam & garlic pizza - slice ($4.60)
*Italian supreme pizza - slice: chicken, spinach, fresh mozzarella and fresh tomatoes ($4.60)
*Pesto pizza - slice: pesto and mozzarella cheese ($4.60)
*Carnivore's delight pizza - slice: pepperoni, meatball, sausage and salami ($5.20)

These slices are huge! My four slices came in what I'm guessing is an extra large pizza box. I really liked the Pesto slice. Nice and simple with the pesto and cheese. The Carnivore delight also fulfilled my meat craving. I just wish it had mushrooms on it as well. The Italian and Clam slices were good too, but my fav was really the Pesto.

*Village special pizza: meatballs, sausage, pepperoni, onions, green peppers, mushrooms (no olives) $22.10 for 14"
The roommate ordered this one. The whole pizzas are a little breadier and have more cheese and toppings. So much so that the toppings kept falling off. But I'm more about toppings than the crust, so I didn't mind.

If I was just rating their whole pizza and chicken wings, I'd give Village 3 stars. But since they deliver individual slices, I'm bumping them up to 4. Perfect for someone like me who always wants to order at least 2 different pizzas!
author: Elena N.

description: Low quality--- thin crust, low-quality cheese.. about as expensive as the premium pizzas.
author: Laura S.

description: The pizza here is fabulous- cheese, or clam & garlic or BBQ- they all are wonderful. The crust is chewy and crunchy with a slight pull. The servers are all wonderful, friendly people. The owners are fantastic. The cooks are fabulous. Carlos goes out of his way to specialize our pizza for us. There are TVs with sports on or whatever you wish. Good music as background- not too loud. I love this place.
author: Me M.

description: It's really hard to make pizza unappetizing. I stopped in today for a slice of pizza and have to say, it was the worst piece of pizza I've ever had. And I'm a NY raised pizza lover. The crust is too thin to support the pizza. The cheap cheese is gummy at best and there's no sauce. Not to mention it's completely devoid of flavor of any kind. Just horrible.
author: Samantha M.

description:
Ordered the first time and was disappointed. First I had a delivery time quoted and it was still another twenty minutes later. It became an 1 1/2 hour wait for pizza. I had to call the restaurant and that is when I found out about the extra twenty minutes! You'd think they would have at least told me without my calling!
 Food wise okay, expensive and not exactly thin crust. Actually, thick crust and okay amount of toppings. Will stick to my usual pizza place..
author: V. P.

description: I've ordered only once before and I thought it was delicious. I called for a delivery today and the girl who answered the phone had laryngitis. I couldn't understand her and I tried to use a coupon and she said it was a different pizza parlor-- terrible phone service. Pizza arrived medium warm and came with the same coupon I tried to use over the phone. Not sure if I'd try to order again; for sure not recommending due to bad service. As for the pizza, it was cold enough that the entire cheese topping would come off of the pizza with the first bite because the cheese had hardened into a hard glob. I hate that.
author: Bebimon C.

description:
I popped in for a couple of slices to go. The interior was okay, maybe a little dim and boring but not a priority for me.

The server was friendly. I ordered two different slices. The toppings look like they were placed on after they had the pizza in the oven and didn't really stick to the pizza. If you're going to fire up a cheese pizza to put off to the side so that you can make custom slices later then please go light on the cheese, par bake, then throw a light layer of cheese on top of the topping so when Your customers go to eat it toppings don't fall off the pizza. The thin crust didn't hold up to the fold and eat style. I folded the pizza and as I lifted it the crust gave up in the middle and every fell into the box. Maybe from being a refry.

Maybe I'll come back to take advantage of their $11 pitcher and give their pizza another try with a fresh baked pie. As far as slices go, I'd go somewhere else though.
author: aaron t.

description:
Ordered a large thin crust & hot wings.

Pizza was very good, tasty toppings, exterior of the crust was pretty dry/crunchy which I don't like, but my girlfriend does.

Wings were good & meaty. They came with carrots and celery which is nice.  I asked for blu cheese but got ranch - I absolutely hate it when that happens which is about 75% of the time at any given place I order wings.
author: Ross H.

description:
Their pizza is solid. Those friends of mine who comment that they cannot get good thin pizza like in NY, tend to be placated here.  

They also have reasonably priced tasty sandwiches that are worth trying.

I mainly come here for their lunch specials, which are available to a generous 4pm.  They are open until 11pm, which is late for restaurants in the Richmond District.
author: Sean P.

description:
We came here for lunch because the kids wanted pizza but Georgio's was crowded.  At first I was hesitant about this place because it was high noon and not a customer to be found.  

Service was prompt and friendly.  The waitress even engaged the kids.  We ordered the large neopolitan Village pizza.  It was good but sort of soggy in the center.  That's ok, eat it with a knife and fork in the beginning and then pick it up and eat with your hands.

What I didn't like was their homemade meatballs.  They were sort of dry and pasty looking for some reason.  

Great service and ok pizza.
author: Wendy H.

description: Best service, staff here are so nice and their recommendation on food won't disappoint you either-- give a try. Locations was great, right in the corner of the block; have phone charging service from Doblet which allows me to charge my phone without chargers of my own, like it very much.
author: Donna Z.

description: Bought 8 pizzas and salad in advance of my daughters birthday with specific instructions on when to deliver and they came through perfectly! Delicious pizza and great service. I'll definitely order again!
author: Duckie A.

description:
*Pizzeria Pizza, slow delivery*

I was happy when I found out delivery was an option.  I was unhappy when the estimated time of 45 minutes was blown past by over an hour.  

Located in a fun part of the Sunset a few blocks from the beach but not anywhere with a high tourist factor.

Ordered:  Cheese pizza.
Cost: $19
$20 minimum for delivery.  I had to order a Fanta.  

Really?

I will try another place next time.
author: Rimi K.

description: The truly test of time my pie was made by the gods each slice of my pie had the same . Consistency of the crust the sauce that blend it very well with the clans and bacon and garlic Pizza my mouth was overwhelmed  I was absolutely in heaven from the very first piece piping hot from the oven to the very last piece sitting there in the box I wanted more wow a whole extra large devoured this could very B one of my last meals
author: Vincent J.

description:
This place is an affront to pizzas -- and humanity -- worldwide. A friend and I were there recently to get some dinner and were instead met with a dining experience which now compels this review.

I ordered two slices of the "Sicilian-style" pizza, which is to say, they bore no resemblance to thick crust pizza, but instead came out as blocky squares of what could only be described as quickly-setting plaster of Paris. On this was draped a layer of sauce so thin that it had all but evaporated during its long sojourn in the oven. On top of this dryness was then stacked an inexplicably spartan layer of cheese (a few shreds, to be generous in description), and a disparate array of vegetables, which had no distinctive flavor of their own. After the first bite, I mused to myself that I have found even pre-packaged school pizzas -- with their artificial ingredients -- to be tastier and more thoughtfully prepared than this. Honestly.

For some strange reason, the owner of this place thought it wise to distinguish his Margherita pizza -- a recipe so divinely and purposefully simple -- with an oily and bland pesto sauce, thereby obliterating not only the point of the original preparation, but taking away from the fresh tomato taste that is unique to this recipe. As I bit into it, the tomatoes that were inartfully thrown on top slid off in various directions, urged forward by the pesto slime, which itself bore no resemblance to its tastier, saltier cousin.

The bottom of these blocks were burned, which made for a startling revelation, as my teeth were confronted with a hard and bitter ending, equally unforgiving on the gums. I tried softening the whole mess with a habanero hot sauce (requested expressly for this purpose), which was the only redeeming item of the night, and which was a local variety made by a company outside of the establishment. For all of its hardness, the crust could not claim even the slightest bit of airiness or save itself with a simple brush stroke of olive oil. No corn meal crust for all of that unyielding crunch. Just flour dough. Hard, dense, blocky, tasteless dough.

Our waitress refilled my friend's soda order, but, seeing my empty glass of water, didn't come back to fill it up. I didn't bother asking, as the waitstaff's presence was a mixed bag of being present merely to clean up the occasional table or take an order, then disappearing together into the recesses of the kitchen. No one came in the middle to ask if our food had been prepared to our liking.

This place has no right to serve anything originating from Italy. I should have known what I was getting into when the smell of pizza didn't even waft out of the front door. Don't waste your money here; go down a block or two to Giorgio's to eat real pizza, and real food.
author: Leena C.

description:
Hungry people fed burnt cardboard and empty pasta.

It was a sad day when Giorgio's computer system shut down and my friend and I had to head over to Village Pizzeria for dinner.

the place was packed when we got there with a kid's sports team taking up 90% of the tables but they left soon after and we had to wait for a table to be cleared.

the waitress sat us at the table which was wet.  not damp but wet.  it was pretty gross.  how hard would it have been to follow  up the wipe down with a dry towel?

my friend ordered two slices of pizza that were rock hard.  I am surprised she didn't cut her gums or crack a tooth.  while the pizza listing did provide descriptions,  the area of the menu with slices did not and we were both surprised when her margherita pizza arrived with pesto on it. Pesto?!  clearly they don't know what margherita pizza is.  which, btw, is one of most recognizable dishes on the planet.  My friend doused it with a hot sauce that made the burnt offerings somewhat  palatable.

For me, I was craving pasta and ordered the penne with sundried tomato, chicken and mushroom.  I am still looking for those ingredients.  my pasta dish was just that, a plateful of boiled pasta drenched in a thin alfredo sauce.  it was very bland.  very.  and if you are ordering something with a strong flavor like sun dried tomato you expect some flavor, you expect to see things other than pasta, at least!

they also charge for soda refills after you've had  one refill.  wow.

Our waitress barely came by the table.  when she cleared my plate she didn't even ask me how it was.  I would have told her!  why didn't we send our food back?  we were starving and tired.  but looking back , I wish I had.

Don't go eat at Village Pizzeria unless you like to punish your taste buds.
author: Debster C.

description: Nothing fancy just reliable and good American style pizza. Great for groups and kids. Sports usually on.
author: E F.

description:
I ordered pizza from them last night. 
Village pizza should hire and train new delivery drivers. This "hipster looking slim white guy with a pony tail" came to my door. I only had a big bill, so he right away asked me how much do I want back. To me that is so rude to automatically assume that he is going to be tipped. I already had the intention of tipping but to ask for it ahead of time, set me back. First of all I wanted to treat my cousin to dinner, and make it special. That idiot just ruined it because my cousin was standing next to me and heard it and gave the guy a tip when I wanted to pay for the whole thing. I work hard for my money as well at my job and I never ever ask, " do you want your change?" That's so disrespectful. What entitles that delivery driver to automatically assume for a tip? It's best sometimes to just shut the fuck up and let the customer tip from their side. You never ask the customer how much do you want back. I work in customer service as well and I will not tolerate this. I will report this to everyone I know not to order from here. The pizza was luke warm and  tasted like cardboard, but honestly I looked passed that, and was more pissed about that delivery driver. 
Be aware of this guy. Again he is (white, dark haired pony tail tied up hair, big nose, tall and skinny, hipster appearance). He's lucky I was patient. He does that to the next person or the wrong person, the outcome could be worse. Village pizza has to fire him, all he cares about is his tip. If they don't get rid of him, they will lose a lot of business.
author: Alex C.

description: Ordered pizza and wings with Eat24. Mushroom, garlic, eggplant and chicken pizza. Pizza had 10 molecule size chicken bits for $3.80. And no mushrooms. Overpriced and upsetting. I swear that chicken wings were dated 1983. Dry, tasteless, cardboard tiny things. This is my first time ever ordering from this place and the last. Too bad because it is 3 blocks away from our house. Avoid it unless you want to overpay for really dry and tasteless food. So sad.
author: Laurie P.

description: We have been ordering pizza for delivery from Village Pizzeria for many years.  The quality has always been pretty erratic, but about half the time it was reasonably good.  Lately, however, things have gotten seriously worse.  It's hard to be sure whether it's the person who takes the telephone orders (always the same woman, who doesn't listen carefully) or, as seems more likely, that the kitchen just pays no attention to any instructions they are given or follows any consistent cooking standards.  The last time we ordered (after several previous complaints) we eventually got a call from the manager and the owner apologizing, but this time there were similar problems and no apologies.  The phone contact did finally agree to take 10 dollars off the price but by that time the pizza was almost cold and the toppings were still as skimpy as ever.  (Don't be fooled by the pictures shown on the website, by the way; they are nothing remotely like what is delivered to your door.)  I regret that I must now look for a new pizza place, but I have just been poorly served too many times and too often erroneously reassured that the service would soon improve for me to continue dealing with this declining and poorly managed business.
author: John R.

description: have both eating at restaurant and had delivery. Usually have delivery of deep dish pizza. Taste good and delivery was pretty fast. Worth checking out
author: Rodger R.

description: One of my favorite Pizza and pasta places in the city. if they do make a mistake you call and the owner fixes it right away and has it redelivered fast. Quality food and always worth the money!
author: John B.

description: The Clam and Garlic pizza is dope af. Delivery is pretty fast too
author: Connie G.

description: I was so very underimpressed with this pizza. The only thing i could taste was the cardboard box it was delivered in. The crust was hard and my $25 gone. Now I know/remember why it's been over a decade since i've ordered from here. just. don't.
author: Wendy X.

description:
Ok, I'm not a fan of pizza, but I came here on the urging of a friend.  I managed to dine here twice, so this review is the culmination of two good experiences here.

First time around my GF and I went half and half on a pizza, and also got a chicken sandwich.

Decor is nice, servers are personable, and the place is clean.  We chose half Village Special, and half Italian Special, in a Neopolitan.  I'll just say I'm still craving that thin crust Italian special, with delicate flavor from the fresh Mozzarella and the other mild ingredients.  The chicken sandwich was typical, but not so much my style.  Had a great time here, and looking forward to coming back.

Second visit I found myself creating my own sandwich...which is a dream for a sandwich connoisseur like me.  Village had all the ingredients for a home run....It was the Chicken/Bacon sandwich, but instead of red sauce, the roll was dressed with garlic butter, and I added lettuce and tomato.  KILLER SANDWICH, not on the menu.

Can't wait to go back!!
author: MacDaddy S.

description: I ordered a half Sicilian pizza and was not impressed with the pre baked crust and sparseness of toppings. The worst part was the price, $30 for half a pizza! Overpriced and not that good on the flavor scale, I wouldn't recommend this place to friends
author: Brit V.

description:
Ordered the Carnivore slice and Pesto w/chicken. The former was served poorly. The meat looked unrecognizable and lacked freshness. The pesto slice made my tummy hurt. 

As for their pasta dishes they'll definitely pass...A-ok
author: Stuart B.

description:
All I can say is Oil and Garlic pasta.  They make this just the way my Uncle did.  The service is always cheerful and they are on top of everything.

I've had a few different dishes here, the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken is just as good.

Don't forget to have the brownie!
author: Kenneth G.

description:
Beware of this place between about 4:30 and 6 pm. It seems to be a refuge for children that bawl, scream, stomp, and kick the baseboards. It's almost impossible to have a conversation. 

The chicken salad and the chef salad are fairly good, and the "small" size is a reasonable portion. The mediterranean salad is good unless they decide to drown it in peperoncini (which happens periodically). The "meat lover" is a tasty pizza, though the cheese can be slippery while being consumed. Prices don't seem unreasonable, at least for SF.

Avoid getting single slices; they arrive as a wide, flat pieces of over-salted dough with a tiny smattering of toppings in the middle. I've tried several flavors and never had one that was more than barely passable.

Giorgio's (a few doors down) has a better aroma wafting out on the sidewalk in front. It's also rather noisy inside (but maybe slightly better in the 4:30 - 6 pm slot!)
author: Donald J L.

description:
I've been here several times and never had a complaint. Food is consistently good (highly recommend their salad and thin crust pizza.  They also include a warm garlic roll with their salad).

Best part: I've been able to alter my order without ever receiving attitude or glares! Also, they have a HUGE HD tv! One time the place wasn't too crowded and I asked the server if they can change the channel. The server genuinely responded 'What would you like to watch?' How NICE! 

Parking can be difficult at night. My secret: I park California or Sacramento Sts. and walk over. The best part of parking further away is that you 'walk off' the good pizza and salad!
author: Johan S.

description: Stopped in with a group of 7 (4 kids). We had a great time!! Pizza was fabulous, thin crispy crust... salad was huge and loaded with veggies!! Service spot on. Sports on the television and clean restrooms rounded out our experience. We enjoy Georgios up the street but wanted a quieter less crowded dinner. They even gave crayons and paper to the kids to keep them busy. Highly recommended!! If you find yourself on the waitlist at georgios (especially with hungry kids) consider this as an option, you won't regret it!!
author: Lauraine E.

description:
The veggie pizza was just ok. I liked the crust more than the pizza. I feel like it could have benefitted from a 2-3 minute broil to cook the top a bit. I found it to be a bit watery/slippery where the toppings slide a bit. 

Not bad or anything just ok.
author: A J.

description:
Today we placed an order for delivery.  The person answering the phone was courteous.

Tonight we ordered a personal plain cheese ($9.00) - no bad, good crust...its all about the crust.

1/2 Sicilian Original BBQ Chicken ($22.90) - this is a square deep dish pie.  There are eight pieces to this order...very hardy.  The pizza has a tangy BBQ sauce in place of the red sauce.  The pie was pretty good...it was filling ...I could only handle 2 pieces.  

Meat Ravioli w/Pesto ($13.00) - cooked perfectly.  Cannot say anything bad about it.

Meat Ravioli w/Alfredo ($13.00) - this was not on the menu, I asked to see if they could do it.  Alfredo was very filling...the sauce was perfect...we used it to dip the bread that came with dinner in.  

The delivery guy came right on time and was courteous...the only thing that he did not do was to offer red chili pepper and grated Parmesan.

I will definitely order from them again.
author: Jerry W.

description: $77 dollars for a large pizza, caprese, glass of wine & pitcher. ( including tip) We asked for a side ranch and they wanted to charge us for it no exceptions. This place should be ashamed!
author: Charles B.

description:
Dry and Disgusting.

That is all that I can really think about after eating a piece of pizza from here. I ordered the sundried tomato and sausage pizza, but I think I accidentally ordered the sand paper piece. That could be my mistake, so if anything just make sure to label your pizzas correctly Village!

Highly do not recommend eating here, why not go a few doors down to Giorgio's?? For your sake, save the health of your mouth.
author: Michelle X.

description:
Horrible customer service. 

We ordered a number of things one being a bowl of soup.(we'd ordered before) only this time it came in a small coffee cup that had spilled all over the rest of our food. No napkins were given and they forgot our brownie. 

We called one time and the lady was happy to tell us how many times we ha ordered in the past. (They promise a free pizza when ordering 10 times) after 11 times ordering  they tell us they have no way of knowing. We had 9 saved receipts and were turned down. We knew it was just too good to be true. We'll take our business else where. We thought we were pretty loyal customers. Guess that means nothing. Oh well there are  plenty of BETTER places in this great city.
author: Heysoos R.

description:
We've been coming here with our kids and other families for awhile now and never had such terrible service as last night. My daughter ordered the kids spaghetti with sausage. When the server brought it out she noticed there was no sausage on her plate. Chalking it up to a miscommunication we decided to wait until the server came back. Well she never did! We then decided to wait until the bill came to see if it was charged, which it was. This is where it got worse than you could ever imagine. 

When we go to pay and mention it, the cashier goes on to tell us that the server Mei said that she gave it to us AND we ate the damn sausage!! The cashier then goes on to ask the cook in the back if they put sausage on the plate an hour ago and he says yes!! Seriously!?  Keep in mind that the extra sausage costs a measly $1 and they think we would lie about not getting it for an $80 bill?! They ended up comping the spaghetti but still charged us the automatic tip for that type of horrible customer service! Too many other great pizza options in the neighborhood than to put up with that. BTW left phone number for manager and have yet to get a call back.
author: Greg T.

description: Worst place ever, I asked for bbq chicken and they also put bacon on my pizza which I didn't ask for!
author: Ali G.

description: The delivery guy from Village Pizzeria was obscenely disrespectful as he opened the door to my home instead of knocking when delivering my order. It was shocking, intrusive, and infuriating because he acted like it was not an issue. What was equally infuriating was that this establishment had not reached out to apologize for this person's disrespectful behavior after my concerns. I can no longer support this business that does not respect the privacy of a customer's home.
author: Melissa R.

description: Really good pizza.  Just be aware that their version of the Margarita is not the usual version.
author: David S.

description: I ordered for delivery and was half pleased with what I got. I ordered the summer salad .. YUM! I'm actually craving this salad as we speak. The chicken on top of my salad arrived still hot off the grill and the toppings were nice and fresh! I'm a bit of a salad snob ( yes we do exist) lol I also ordered the chicken penne with mushrooms and sun dried tomatoes, which Is why I'm only giving 4 out of 5 stars. The pasta wasn't nearly as tasty as the salad which was disappointing but I'm definitely ordering again from here. I'll try one of their pizzas next and can't forget my summer salad on the side :)
author: Julie F.

description:
Eh, generally I'm not a huge pizza fan so I may not be the best judge; despite this, I actually thought it was decent. I ordered the margarita pizza and loved the basil and tomato combo, Mm mm, I couldn't help but be grossed out that the slice dripped though... food shouldn't drip unless it is in the form of soup or a Summer peach. Lesson learned: dripping pizza, not so cute. 

Service, however, was outstanding! That may be since we were the only two in the restaurant but still, we had the friendliest waitress. Slightly concerning was the fact that at 7:15pm on a Monday we were the only two in a restaurant. I can't say I would ever choose to go back, although I also can't complain since all-in-all the experience cost fewer than five dollars.
author: Zoey S.

description:
Ive been coming to Village for close to two years now. I really enjoy their food. Pizza is consistent and the meat is top notch. Salads are great and reasonably priced.  Pasta Is good too. 

I have been to all of the local pizza joints. This place has the most diverse selection with great taste. 

I highly recommend trying out Village at least once.
author: Tim B.

description:
This place is amazing! The Italian food is incredible beyond just the pizza plus it's delivery. The food always arrives hot and fresh. If you want Italian delivered you can't do better this.

Try the bruschetta and the meat balls
author: Michael P.

description:
This was very good food considering it was delivered.

Meat Calzone
It was a touch soggy on the bottom. and it is a little messy to eat. However, the ingredients were fresh. and everything came together nicely. The pepperoni and the sausage were both very good.

Penne with tomato
This was a basic penne dish but it was nice. Sometimes simple is better. I did add a little salt and used the included parmesan. This was penne with a very simple and light tomato sauce with basil. The basil was just the right touch.

Garlic bread with cheese
This was very good garlic bread. The perfect add-on.

Delivery was very prompt, professional, and polite
author: Mark D.

description:
I have reason to believe that the folks in the neighborhood order from Village Pizzeria only for delivery most of the time because I absolutely agree with the fair number of previous reviewers who have stated that this place seems to always be empty.  

I walk by the corner spot often, and I usually see an empty restaurant.  It was pretty empty on the Friday night that I visited; only three other tables were occupied and this was at the peak of the dinner hour.  I walked in, took my own seat, grabbed a menu and studied it for a good ten minutes before I put in my order.  Sometimes, the great thing about an empty restaurant is fast service.  From the time I ordered my pizza a mere fifteen minutes had passed before I found a hot pizza sitting in front of me (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QAMEktS2QgJ-Yl2ooERmgw?select=yjUYhXkKCnQw7ldrG2NGGw).

I ordered a personal size 9 inch Italian Supreme with the regular thin crust and a fountain drink.  The pizza was cut into six slices.  The Italian Supreme combines a thick layer of cheese, thinly sliced tomatoes, spinach leaves and seasoned cubes of chicken meat over a thick, tangy red sauce.

The thin crust is crisp and chewy almost crunchy on the edges.  I found fault with this crust however.  First of all it lacked flavor; it didn't even have the flavor of fresh baked bread.  While the bottom crust remained hard and crispy the dough in between the bottom crust and the layer of tomato sauce was actually very moist.  I think another reviewer described it as being soggy.  It's definitely better to eat the pizza while it's hot because the problem occurred after the pizza had sat out for awhile.  It could have been that it just soaked up the moisture from the sauce and the thick layer of toppings, but the first slice of the pizza definitely tasted better than the third, fourth, fifth or sixth slices.  Overall though I'd have to admit that the chicken was seasoned quite well and the toppings were all fresh.  The pizza was actually pretty good.

You can order canned sodas or fountain sodas for an extra ten cents.  Definitely go for the fountain option if you're dining in because it includes one refill.  An assortment of beer and wine is also available.  If you're eating in check out the big wall full of vintage photos of Sutro Baths and Playland at the Beach.  It's quite interesting.  Good service.  The young lady asked me several times if things were okay.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: This is by far my favorite pizza place to order for delivery in the city. Their food is delicious, prices very reasonable- especially compared to what you get for the cost at some other places (cough, cough- Amici's), and their service is above and beyond. I place very large orders for our company and they work to accommodate us and it's always a hit with people asking where it's from. Today I got a follow up call to ask how the order was for a happy hour yesterday. I'd thrown a few curve balls in like cutting the slices very small for finger food servings, and they did that plus calling to make sure it all worked. I'm always impressed and happy when I order here.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Overcrowded.

Possible Village fate if word gets out:

- "Small" chicken salad with grilled chicken and artichoke hearts is actually massive
- Neapolitan pizza has a small price but large portion
- Homemade brownies are a perfectly decadent finale
- All the above are delicious and come with very friendly and accommodating service

Population could soon get out of hand.
author: Jason B.

description: I am surprised about some negative reviews over here. Me and my girlfriend came here on Thursday night and we ordered veggie pizza ,service was absolutely superb and pizza was awesome!!! Definitely 5 stars
author: Denis A.

description: Tried the Italian supreme pizza and was very impressed. All of the ingredients tasted very fresh. I waited a while before trying this place because of the mixed reviews, but I wish I would have tried it sooner. New go-to pizza place!
author: Nicole I.

description: After visiting and ordering from the Van Ness Village pizzeria well over 100 times, I finally ate at the Village on Clement for the first time this past weekend.  And I'm happy to report that it passed my examination and is every bit the same as the Van Ness location.   As I detailed in my review of the Van Ness location- the way to go here is the Sicilian thick crust pizza- the thin crust is tasty, but rather ordinary.  Get a half or whole Sicilian pizza with pesto and tomato sauce mixed, add pepperoni, extra cheese, and garlic- and enjoy!
author: Andy S.

description: Ordered some pizza from here for a class pizza party. It was amazing. The pizza was thin, which is exactly the way I like it and the flavors were awesome. I could really taste the herbs and flavors they put into the pizza. The customer service was also a plus! The staff that delivered the pizza was very sweet and made sure we got everything we needed.  I would definitely come back to grab a slice or two :)
author: Anna C.

description: I found this spot on GrubHub. We ordered an order of spaghetti with bolognese sauce and a large Caesar salad. It overestimated the delivery time so it came early in about 45 minutes. It costs about 25 bucks total for both items. Not cheap but not expensive. The salad was great and the spaghetti was tasty. It also came with a cinnabon looking garlic bun that was great for dipping in the sauce. It was nice to order some non-pizza items for delivery.
author: Marty J.

description: I do not write reviews (for restaurants) unless I have been to a place at least twice.  The first time I ordered a pizza from them (delivery), it was dry and and cold (I had to microwave it before even taking my first bite).  I thought maybe they were having an off night, so a few months later, I ordered delivery from them again  - AGAIN, dry and cold pizza.  That's it.  No third chance, sorry.  I ALWAYS want to patronize local business opposed to chain restaurants, and I gave this place two tries and both were disappointments.  Maybe they are better with in-restaurant dining, I don't know. There are way too many great restaurants in this city to go to one that is less than mediocre.
author: Sofia G.

description: Found this place on accident and glad we did. Needed a place to eat while visiting my daughter at USF and it happened to be during the WS with the Giants. The food was tasty and priced appropriately. The staff was friendly , even though I am a Dodger fan. We will be back.
author: Paul M.

description:
A nice little joint at the corner of Clement and Arquello.  Acting like curious cats we went in and got seated.  We ended up ordering the 16" thin crust, half of it the Bacon Pizza and the other half the Carnivore's Delight.  All I can say is YUM!  The crust was crispy and light, the sauce was mild (the way we like it), and the toppings were great.  A definite nice change from the usual pizza we've been having, especially from a native San Franciscan like myself.

Since we liked it here we also decided to have our daughter's birthday party here on a Saturday afternoon and they happily reserved enough tables and seats for 36 people.  I additionally requested that extra tables be reserved by the window for all the pizza we ordered for the party (buffet style) plus a table for a 1/2 sheet cake.  For a hungry party that size I ended up ordering about 12 large thin crust pizzas (16") along with about 5 orders of the garlic pesto & cheese bread.  We especially loved the Bacon pizza.  All I heard from our guests were compliments on how good the pizza was and that it was a great place to have a party.  There's a small party store 1/2 a block away on Arguello that you can check out.  I ordered some balloon sets from there, they delivered and help set them out on the tables, really convenient.

Give this place a try, you might like it :) ...and then you can always walk down to Toy Boat afterwards for some ice cream or other dessert.

Update on 3/21/08 visit:
Came here with family (15 of us) for pizza dinner and got some tables together.  Roaring hungry we ordered 3 extra large bacon pizzas, 2 pepperoni and 1 village special.  Super super yum.  I totally still love this place.  Nothing like fresh, hot, thin pizza.  Super kudos to Diane who helped serve us all!  Next time I'm gonna bring her some fruit roll-ups.  Note to self:  pepperoni is spicy...
author: Emy B.

description: Good pizza! It's a bit greasy but nothing a few pats on a napkin can't fix! Crust was alright on the pizza. The garlic bread was meh but was good for its price and wasn't too garlicky, it was just average. Everything came out really fast also. Even though Giorgio pizza has better reviews and  is down the road you should give this place a shot!
author: Avery A.

description:
Why in this Mecca of Asian cuisine and vast array of other eateries, did I drag the BF here on a Sunday afternoon...Mostly because I was starving but also because I wasn't feeling adventerous and this was the first place we stumbled across.
It's "sit anywhere" type of place and smelled decent enough.
I liked the thin crust-it was the right combo of crispy and doughy without being soggy. Good veggies, seemed fresh.
Sauce was 'aight. Nothing to rave about. But it was filling and delicious. Not cheap, but I've found that to be the case with pizza in SF. What the what? I could imagine calling them for delivery if I lived nearby.
author: Jennifer N.

description: A smile is worth a million bucks, guys. Please work on your customer service skills. Pizza and beer was good, especially beer was served in an ice-cold mug.
author: Christine S.

description:
Yum this place is awesome and so is there delivery!

Thin crust made the way it should be - not burnt, just crispy and saucy right to the edge! Perfect.

I typically order a custom pizza with pepperoni and jalapenos and pineapple. I find their pepperoni particularly good - not too greasy but still salty and delicious!

Eggplant rollatini was pretty good too

and they have this dessert that is disgustingly fantastic with bananas and condensed milk on a pizza - I know it sounds foul but give it a shot so yummy!

And delivery is always prompt and the delivery guys are typically very friendly.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
I should have walked out when I did not see any pizza pies on display. A Latino making pizza behind the counter was caution #2, but I gave him the benefit of the doubt that he could do a great job. Wrong! 

Ordered a slice with veggie combo and a piece of Sicilian with plain cheese. Two customers were sitting at the stools who already ordered. A couple sitting in the dining room who already got their pizza. No one came in after me. Nonetheless, waited nearly fifteen minutes! When I asked the waitress how much longer, she did not go up to the "cook" and ask, but rather told the guy coming on shift that I'm waiting for a pick up. I looked over the cook and he's preparing a pizza dough. I walked up to the counter and then he goes to the oven to box up my order. 

Being in a hurry, I rushed back to the car. Need I tell you how the pizza was after being in the oven that long? TOAST practically. 

I think the Sicilian could have taken the long heating IF the crust was made well, not a gloried piece of toast on which a thin slather of sauce and some cheese were thrown on top. Very dry. Seems like a Sicilian crust is a lost art in the Bay Area. At least so far. 

So the search goes on. 

For others, go down the block to Clement and 3rd and try Giorgio's. I have had decent slices there and had I had more time, I would have gone there to sample their pizza again to see if they are still good. 

Just stay away from Village Pizzaria.
author: A A.

description:
Bland, food, mediocre ingredients, arrived cold. Seriously, you can get better lasagne at the supermarket.

The best thing about the meal was the pre-bagged romaine lettuce in the Cesar salad. Skip it.
author: Monarch B.

description: Not as good as Giorgio's but a nice change. Especially because they deliver a bit later than Giorgio's.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Friendly and attentive staff. We ordered a few salads which were all great. Very fresh ingredients. A couple of big screens to catch the Giants v Royals and a restaurant full of families made for a great experience. Pizza was pretty good. Homemade sausage was delicious.
author: Patrick E.

description: Thought I would try this place again after many years. I ordered the Scicillian pepperoni (the square thick slices) and the crust and sauce were both terrible. The crust had that sweet and over toasted taste of a crappy Digorno grocery store home bake. Hard to chew and sickeningly bland and sweet at the same time. The pizza sauce/paste  was incredibly salty. We ended up throwing away 3 slices because it was basically inedible.  I really like this style of pizza and I was trying to find a place that served scicillian slices closer to me than Golden Boy, but I guess I'm back to Golden Boy which has never let me down.
author: C S.

description:
So I just finished eating the pizza maybe 5 or 10 minutes ago and I don't know if I'm in a food high or what but that pizza was pretty awesome!
We ordered a large mushroom and peperoni pizza and it took them only about 30-35 minutes to get it to us.
The large is actually a large which is becoming hard to find in the city (why are some pizza places giving out "large" pizzas that look like a medium) 
This place was on the pricey side but not by much if you actually take into account how expensive San Francisco really is.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
The life saver!! My son and I were ready to eat lunch while we were trying to pass the time between doctor appointments. EATS was crowded so we walked down the street to the corner and came across this diamond. My son is a fan of PIZZA, of course, so we walked in. We both had a slice of pepperoni pizza and I had a side salad. The salad was fresh, crisp and made to order. 
You can get pizza anywhere...yes...what makes this pizza stand out is the seasonings that swim around in your mouth. It was a bit greasy, but we still will return to have a little more. Maybe even try something different.
author: Mia B.

description:
This is my go-to (or deliver-from) place when I want pizza.

The Village Pizza pizza is simply awesome thin crust pizza.

I've been eating pizza at interesting places for 40+ years. I've done most of the "Rays" places in NYC. My high school years were a steady diet of Caserta http://www.yelp.com/biz/caserta-pizzeria-providence

In San Francisco, I've had most of the better know pizzas (North Beach, Gaspare's, Girogio's, etc.)

I keep coming back to Village. It's just excellent, tasty, quality pizza.
author: David P.

description:
Great service!
Ordered a couple of thin cheese slices that were decent.
Pizza had a weird accompanying taste which keeps me from giving a five star...probably was too close to something else on the rack.
author: Beth N.

description: This place isn't bad. Good pizza. Has taken them 2 hours once to deliver my semi-warm pizza. And it was the wrong order. Said they would give me 50% off my next order, gave me their name for reference, then wouldn't grant it on my next order. So that was disappointing.
author: Donnie K.

description:
So disappointed!
Village used to be our go to pizza place, but the last 3 times I've ordered the pizza has been a crappy old pizza that has been sitting around. It tasted and looked like a pizza that has been sitting in a box for a few hours. Stale and hard. NOT worth $20+!
I will not order from here again.
author: Jaclyn M.

description: I was SUPER stoked on this place. I got the breakfast pizza, which was just an amazing idea in the first place -- EGGS instead of sauce! Super cool. The service was awesome. We were one of two groups in the place and the waitress was extremely friendly, clearly was happy to be there and help us, and definitely made the time there worthwhile. Really want to go back, next time I'm in the area I for sure will.
author: Halley H.

description: Worst pizza I ever had. Ate most of one piece and that was it. Margarita pizza with extra cheese. It is dry and tastes like it has creamed spinach on it. And God help the regular pizza if this has extra cheese. Very disappointed. Second time. Wont do it again. Gave it a two because he was on time with delivery.
author: blaine b.

description: I made the mistake of letting my roommate introduce me to this place when we first moved into our apartment. I had their BBQ chicken pizza and it has ruined all other pizza for me.
author: Zoë B.

description: So I was feeling hungry after shopping so I stopped in to get a pizza it was great and big the lady was aswome and friendly and the French bread tasted good good place to go if you need a quick bite
author: Jerome S.

description:
thick Sicilian crust is buttery and robust, its like deep dish pizza on steroids. 

toppings are high-quality.

parking sucks if youre going to pick up or dine in.

they need to regulate how much red sauce they put on their pizzas it may over power the pie depending on your palette,
author: Peter T.

description:
I love Village - my favorite "normal" pizza place to get delivery from.

No frills, great options, albeit expensive (hey, you're in SF - get used to it).

The dining experience there isn't as good, however - it's often a bit empty. Good beer specials though.
author: Bill R.

description:
I couldn't order pizza from Bella, cause they were closed for a week for some reason. I was looking forward to having some good pizza, since my coworker mentioned to me that this place was, "oh oh good!" 

The cardboard thin, no flavor tomato sauce, barely there cheese, with flat sausage that came from my elementary school cafeteria tasting pizza finally arrived. 

Wish it hadn't....Oh Bella!
author: Carla F.

description: Pleasantly surprised - ordered thin crust vegetarian takeout pizza.  Was actually quite good.  Would definitely get pizza here again.
author: Jayne H.

description: I really like this place!  I come here way more than I should, probably like once a week.  It's consistently good, and they have great lunch specials.  I LOVE their spinach salad and house-made vinagrette.
author: Amanda F.

description: I just moved in around the corner from this place so i knew I had to give it a try. We ordered one of their specialty pizzas to go, but while we waited we decided to have a drink. The lady working there was a sweetheart and because of her alone we will be back! I wasn't blown away by the pizza to be honest (some more of the toppings would be a good touch) but on Monday and Thursday they have some great beer pitcher prices which is pretty sweet. With that said, it was the service i walked away from enjoying more than anything.
author: Tyler L.

description:
Pizza is good.  Crust is thin, crispy, and chewy.  Broad selection of pizza and every other food you can imagine they'd have in a pizzeria.

Garlic bread is OK.  Caprese is good for a pizza joint.

Good place to take the kids.  Servers are kid friendly and the place is spacious.
author: Mark F.

description:
Despite my never ending quest to stick to a planned diet, I had a few kids that I was babysitting and they like pizza. If it's in my house, i have the right to eat it :)

5:10pm-i walk in and order a pesto and cheese pizza. I order PINEAPPLE on it (don't judge) and even pay the ridiculous 1.34 extra. 

5:25pm- i receive my pizza and i'm flying out the door to greet the kids there were going to be at my house at 5:45 in the sunset district. 

5:26pm- I look in the box and low and behold.. NO PINEAPPLE!!! I would have stormed back into that place and yelled at some pizza people but luckily for them babysitting takes precedent over their ability to make a correct pizza.

those are my series of events and i do like the taste of their pizza, however, i am not a true connoiseur of pizza so pizza hut will have to do next time.  4 stars for the taste and speed of the pizza. 1 star off for forgetting the 1 topping i ordered.
author: Deanna W.

description: I've been going here since I was a kid. The pizza is legit, it's pretty thin and perfectly toasty on the outside. It's not a cheap pie but you get what you pay for. I usually get veggie or chicken pesto..very yummy. Nice enough to dine in but I tend to order delivery. The service is nice it's a convenient location, plenty of street parking.  Sometimes they don't put enough sauce on the pizza so I'm taking off a star.
author: Natasha F.

description: Sadly, have to take away one more star.  This was a delivery because I'd spent most of the day having medical test run and I just didn't feel like making food once I got home.  I came home to very  hungry people.  It was also delivery.  On the initial delivery, they didn't bring one of the pizzas we ordered and paid for, I had to call to tell them and they would call me back when they figured out what went wrong.  About 15 mins later I got a call back saying the delivery guy left the pizza outside in front door.  Didn't knock, didn't call to say he was there, just put it down on the ground in front of the building and left.  I mean, is that a good business practice?  Anyone could have walked off with it--they walk off with UPS/FedEx/USPS packages left outside the front door, a pizza is a sure bet.  And you leave clean food on the floor, a public floor???  I should take the other 2 stars away just for that idiocy.   On top of that, they got the order wrong.  We ordered 1 meatball sandwich, 1 eggplant sandwich and 1 sausage sandwich but instead of a meatball sandwich, they sent over an eggplant sandwich, so we have 2 eggplants sammies.  Are these even similar?  Do kids generally like plain eggplant?  Not even breaded eggplant , just sliced eggplant with red sauce and cheese on it in a roll.   Ok, I love eggplant and will eat both eggplant  sandwiches because had to trade my sausage sammie just to make the whining and crying stop.  They really need to instate better quality control practices so when orders go out to the customers everything is as ordered and all items are included.  If it's a problem with the delivery person, talk to him to READ (I'm assuming he can read considering he's driving a car) the receipt to make sure he (1) takes everything on the receipt with him when he leaves the restaurant so nothing gets left behind or missed, and (2) READ THE RECEIPT AGAIN when he takes the stuff out of his car so he has everything on the receipt when he delivers to the door--and for God's sake, spend a minute waiting for the recipient to answer the door, DO NOT LEAVE FOOD OUTSIDE ON THE GROUND and assume it's going to be ok.  This isn't Mayberry USA.  This isn't the only pizza place in town, we have lots of them, so Village Pizzeria, since their food isn't anything to brag about, has to do much better if they want to continue to compete in the food market.
author: Kai T.

description:
We visited Village Pizzeria because of the readily available tables and the TV in the corner that was rightfully tuned in to the Giants game.

The garlic bread with cheese and pesto was a satisfying appetizer while we waited for our pizzas.  Although we realized it was something we could easily make for ourselves at home, we did not regret the order.

Our choices of Italian Supreme, pesto with chicken, original BBQ chicken, and Village Special were all worth a try.  Although the crusts could have used some more flavor, the toppings were generous and quality acceptable.  

The service at Village Pizzeria stood out.  Our servers readily refilled our drinks and asked if we needed anything else.  They were cheerful and did not mind that we were slowly eating and enjoying the baseball game.  Even after we had paid our bill, they invited us to stay and to take our time.

Although the pizzas were slightly average, the relaxed atmosphere and great service would convince me to visit again, especially on game days.
author: Andrew M.

description: I hate their pizza. We ordered a village pizza and it smelt horrible. The bread was thin and the crust was very hard. We did not like it at all. I also ordered a small Margherita   it stinks so badly that I will NEVER order from here ever again. I rather go to nizarios pizza
author: Victoria T.

description: Used GrubHub to make an online delivery order, waited an hour and a half and food does not show up.  I call Village Pizza and they say they don't have my order, but I tell them GrubHub has already charged my credit card.  The woman goes on and on saying they have problem with GrubHub orders not getting to them on an iPod.   Then when I get a message from GrubHub they give the excuse my order did not arrive because the restaurant did not have a driver.    Terribly ridiculous customer service on both ends and will not order from them again.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Quick to be seated ( we were only the 3rd table @ 6:15 on Sunday evening), after the order was taken, our waiter disappeared.   Waited forever to have our water glasses refilled, after asking for it at the end of our meal.  Pizza was skimpy on the toppings and the sauce tasted bland, crust was thin and on the hard/crunchy side. Not a great pizza experience. 

Maybe just a bad night, but I'll pass on this place for awhile......
author: Ed J.

description:
I really wanted to like Village Pizza.  It is just around the corner from my daughter's ballet school and would make for a really convenient place to have food after her class was over.  We have eaten there several times and right now I have to say that the convenience does not overcome the mediocrity of the pizza.

Think SALT.  These pizzas are very salty and they have just been getting saltier and saltier every time we go.  Once, we thought that it was just the pepperoni or sausage that they were using, but the cheese pizza that we got from them had the same salt problem.

Overall, after trying a number of foods here, I will have to say that going to Georgio's a block away is the better bet for a satisfying meal.  I'll take the noise and the wait to get a seat over the salt.  The best thing here, honest to god, were the brownies--and I would recommend their brownies to anybody.  This ain't a brownie store though, it's a pizzeria, and they are going to have to make some big changes before they become a good one.
author: Matthew D.

description: OUTSTANDING PIZZA!!  We love this place and bring the entire yoga class here on Fridays.  They usually have a group of kids there on Fridays too but they leave early. They serve delicious salads that are plenty hearty for a crowd.  We are a group of 6-8 and generally split a Greek and Caprese salad as well as 2 large good old fashioned pizzas and everyone is full with a slice of two left over to take home.  We love the mushroom and olive pizza and they have a Estefeta pizza that's amazing.  It's got artichoke hearts, feta, roasted peppers and pesto.  So yummy, and my personal favorite.  I recommend extra crispy crust!  We highly recommend this place, the food is awesome and the price is right.  We're pizza connoisseurs and this checks all the boxes for taste, flavor, value and a great home made crust.  We're regulars here and it's consistently fabulous.  Thanks for great pizza and excellent service!
author: Lorraine D.

description: Greasy and burnt -There's a reason why this place is always empty - I should have known.  Giorgios is two blocks away and worth waiting for
author: S M.

description: i have ate here on a few emergency lunch breaks. But the pizza keeps getting worse its to greasy and thick crust slices are horrible too much crust not enough sauce  cheese and toppings. I will not be returning.
author: La Tasha K.

description: Da bomb.. hand down. I'll go work shows at the Regency/Grand Ballroom JUST to get the cheesy garlic bread... Pizza rocks too... Don't miss it.. Cozy, lots of interesting things to look at, parking sucks of course but that's the city for you.
author: Bret B.

description:
Okay, I've decided it is expensive.  But, it's the best damned calzone you've ever had!  My friend from LA came in town last weekend and we came back from Sonoma fairly late with a lot of great wine.  We drank an Iron Horse Estate Pinot Noir with a large calzone stuffed with cheese, sauce, garlic, sausage, pepperoni, black olives, green peppers and onions.  We ate almost all of it and the bottle was well finished.  What we couldn't stuff in that night we ate for breakfast the next morning!!!  
The Village Special is great too...I cannot resist you Village Pizzeria!!!  My waistline will suffer...GGgrrrrr!!!
author: Sean M.

description:
If you like thin crust pizza then this is definitely the place to go to.  It's super thin and pretty good!

I've had a variety of pizzas here, some on the menu and some I've created on my own.  Usually very satisfied!  

This place is great for big parties! On many occasions, I've seen soccer teams, basketball teams, and little kids' celebrate here!  

Service is great and parking...is not too bad! 

If you're looking for a pizza place to grab dinner or to celebrate some special occasion...go to Village!
author: Sarah F.

description: great people here.  i was with my son at my daughter's lengthy ballet performance.  just needed a place to chill have some beers for me and coke for son.  they were very nice and we got a big table just to chill.  we did that again later in the afternoon when we had a break.  they were very cool.  we've had pizza here before, very good.  pesto clam.  i enjoyed the funny chinese (i'm chinese so its okay) family tasting red wines...
author: Kevin L.

description: Slice and a soda for a five spot.  What's not to like?
author: Russell D.

description:
Once upon a time, I was in a cafe in northern Italy in which the waters of lago de Magiore licked the banks of the cafe. On that day, I had a pizza al tonno. It was a lovely thin, cruncy pie with tuna, onions, and capers. Now I am not a fan of capers, so the latter has been edited from my reminiscing. The pizza was delightful and since my departure nearly 20 years ago from Europe (I lived in Switzerland for about 4 years), I have been on a quest in the  U.S. to find a pizza with tuna.

Tonight, I have finally noshed on one that was not made by me. This pizza was quite good but needs some fine tuning (not a pun) on my ordering.

My order: a 14" with tuna and red onions with red sauce on Neapolitan crust.

Pros: 
- A good balance of onions and tuna. 
- The onions were nicely caramelized. 
- The tuna wasn't nasty vegetable oil/water canned Starkist or Chicken-of-the-Sea... It had the texture of Spanish or Italian tuna canned in olive oil.
- Crust had a nice crunch and was thin.

Cons: 
- Red sauce was a bad match (and a little salty) with the toppings (my fault).
- Albeit light and crunchy, the crust was a bit chewy. But, I have yet to find a place in the U.S. that makes a true European pizza crust, so I cannot fault Village too much on this. They would get 6 stars if they did.
- Pizza here ain't cheap. A delivered two topping 14" was $24 (no additional charge for delivery). However, a lot of GOOD pizza places in the Richmond can be pricey. And, since my hubby will likely not touch this pizza with a 10-foot pole, I do have about 3 meals from this puppy.

So, I will definitely work on fine-tuning my order and if I find the right match of sauce or additional toppings, Village Pizzeria will get 5 stars.
author: Melissa W.

description:
I was in a rush and I stopped by this place to grab a quick bite to eat. I was impressed that they were able to bake my pizza fresh.

However, I was unimpressed with their pizza in general. It was too greasy and there was not very much flavor it in. The one thing I did like was their portions. They slices are very generous, I just wish the pizza tasted better.

Maybe next time I'll try their pasta.
author: Janice A.

description:
On xmas eve, I took Claire out for a bit of last minute shopping in this area.  We were both feeling a bit flu-ish so there was a decided lack of frenetic energy.  In order to make it really easy on ourselves and the BF who was at home watching the kids, we thought that a pizza, for lunch would be a great idea.

I ordered 1/2 margherita, 1/2 veggie.  It was a bit expensive.  About $26 or $28?  The crust was really thin and crispy and it did not take longer than 15 mins to make.  I know this because I had to FEED THE METER ON XMAS EVE.  WHAT THE EFF?  ARE YOU SERIOUS?

We brought the pizza home, it smelled really nice.  Claire set it up in the living room for the kids to eat while they committed further destruction on the BF's furniture and other nice things he likes.  When I came through from the kitchen, the first thing I hear is Ari, in her near-screaming voice shouting at her mother: "I TOLD you I wanted pizza with ONLY cheese, I DON'T LIKE this, with all this STUFF on it.  YOU PICK IT OFF."  And then she proceeded to cross her arms, flail around, jump up and down on the couches and pout while looking completely entitled and yet dejected as though the pizza was chosen for the purpose of taunting her with it.  

By the time I ate it, the pizza had been manhandled by the kids who perpetually had their fingers in unspeakable places, even after they were washed with soap.  Somehow, the time between washing up for a meal and eating the food was too long for them to resist touching everything they had just washed off their hands.  I thought the pizza tasted a little bland.  Usually I buy cheese pizzas to get a base reading.  However, that week, I was in no state to make rational decisions nor was I able to make choices that reflect my actual tastes and preferences for food, drink, activities, or lifestyle.  

It was a bit expensive but it's pizza and I can see myself ordering a plain cheese one some time in the future.  I'll give it another go.
author: Christina C.

description:
Food is good but service is rather poor. 

My second time coming here since my first experience was pretty decent. 

It was such a horrible choice. We walked in and were not greeted. Decided to wait for someone to seat us and one of the workers just pointed in a general direction and didn't even say anything to us. We ordered a pasta dish and a pizza to split between two people. 

Honestly, the food here is pretty good but obviously, it's hard to enjoy it when you feel so out of place. 
It wasn't a packed place when we went and we had to flag someone down in order to get any service. Also the guy (with tattoos on his arms) helping us talked to us like we were complete idiots or that we had no money to pay for the bill. I felt so uncomfortable afterwards. 

When our pizza came out, we didn't receive any additional plates to place the pizza on. I'm only complaining about this because all the other tables that I saw the servers serve had additional plates. And the guy only checked on our table once the whole time. Didn't offer to refill the water until after he gave us our bill. 

I'm not sure if he's prejudice or racist but everyone else around us were being helped and attended to except for us. They had like 3 people behind the counter and none of them came by to even ask if we needed more water or anything. (We were out of water before our pizza even arrived) We just ate quickly and boxed everything else up and paid our bill and left. This was such a horrible experience, I regret leaving such a large tip the first time I came here.
author: Rebecca T.

description: Village Pizzeria makes some of the best thin crust pizza in the city.  I love their veggie pizza, which has the perfect balance of veggies and cheese.  My husband and I usually dine in here even though most of the time we're the only ones there.  I think most of their business is made up of delivery orders as I see pizzas leaving the restaurant at a furious pace.
author: Julie P.

description:
service was great, that place was clean, but the pizza was not-so-great.
very hard tasting and bland, not enough cheese or sauce.  Pizza is not supposed to be crunchy!
author: Pug P.

description:
We like the thin crust pizzas here.  I tried the clam in white sauce pizza once and it was not too shabby.

We've ordered delivery three times now.  

The delivery can take 1 hour 5 minutes, as it did yesterday when we ordered one extra large at 12 PM.  All us mommies at the play group at my house were starving by the time the pizza arrived at 1.10 PM.  I feel bad because I was host.  It arrived overcooked and the cheese was hardening.  The driver said they don't have a lot of drivers and he had to make a delivery downtown prior.

I was told on the phone that they were busy, so just be prepped to wait a long time for delivery.  

Giorgio's doesn't deliver, so we get delivery from here when we don't feel like driving.  But after twice having to wait 45 minutes or more to be delivered pizza five blocks to my house, next time I will pick it up.  But when we have to pick up, we prefer Giorgio's instead.  So you can see the dilemma here.

The prices online don't reflect the actual price.  Free 2 liter pop if you order extra large online.
author: Mrs F.

description: GREAT!! Everything is really good Especially there SICILIAN style Pizza!!!
author: Alana R.

description:
